intro: Damnacanthus lutchuensis, commonly known as the Lutchuena or Lutchuense devil's claw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia, including India and Thailand. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spurred flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant features linear, succulent leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
